intro: Rhyncholacis varians, commonly known as the variable rhyncholacis, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its unique, often variable leaf morphology, which can range from lobed to entire depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a feature common in the Euphorbiaceae family. Its growth habit is usually shrub-like, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Rhyncholacis varians is considered a species of conservation concern.
